content.heroTitle: Tree Care in Dundee That Honors Your Historic Neighborhood
content.heroDescription: Dundee's 100-year-old oaks deserve expert care. We're ISA Certified Arborists who understand the mature canopy that defines your neighborhood—from Memorial Park to the Underwood strip.
content.primaryServiceFocus: Mature Tree Care & Emergency Storm Response

localLandmarks: Memorial Park (we've worked on the oak grove along the east side multiple times)
Brownell Talbot School (know the pickup/dropoff traffic patterns)
The Dundee Dell restaurant (iconic local spot on Underwood)
Happy Hollow Club area (adjacent neighborhood we also serve)
The Underwood strip between 50th and 51st (tight commercial parking)
proximityTips: Parking is tight on Underwood Ave on weekends—we schedule large equipment jobs for weekday mornings
We park behind the Dundee Library on 50th Street when street meters are full
Memorial Park Loop can flood after heavy rain—we check ground conditions before bringing cranes
Dodge Street access from the south is fastest for emergency calls
Many Dundee alleys are narrow—we scout access routes before removal jobs

commonProblems.question: Do I need a permit to remove a tree in Dundee?
commonProblems.answer: Yes, if the tree is on the city right-of-way (between the sidewalk and street), you need a permit from the City of Omaha Forestry Division. Trees on private property (behind the sidewalk) do not require a city permit, but we always verify property lines before removal. Dundee has strict tree ordinances because of its historic canopy—we handle all permit coordination for you.

commonProblems.question: How do I treat Oak Wilt in Dundee's mature bur oaks?
commonProblems.answer: Dundee is full of 80-100 year old bur oaks, and Oak Wilt is a serious threat here. If you see leaves wilting from the tips inward (starting in mid-summer), that's a red flag. We use fungicide injections for early-stage infections and can set up a treatment plan to protect valuable specimens. For infected trees beyond saving, removal must happen immediately—and we sterilize equipment between jobs to prevent spread to neighboring oaks.

commonProblems.question: What should I do if a tree falls during a storm near Memorial Park?
commonProblems.answer: Call us immediately at (402) 812-3294—we offer 24/7 emergency response. If the tree is on power lines, call OPPD first (402-536-5400), then call us once power is secured. Dundee's mature trees often drop large branches during windstorms, especially the oaks along the park perimeter. We can arrive within 2-4 hours for true emergencies and have the equipment to handle the large-diameter wood common in this neighborhood.
